docs.title: What we have seen last week
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Commands recap
docs.text:
• git init Initialize a git repository
  • git add <file_name> add a file to staging area
  • git commit -m "an explicit message"
  • git push origin <branch_name>
  • git branch <branch_name> create a new branch
  • git checkout <branch_name> switch to branch <branch_name>
  • git checkout -b <branch_name create and switch to new branch <branch_name>

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: Bonus
docs.text: Create a continuous integration pipeline using github action to automate test execution on pull request and on merge
